value.title: Unethical AI unfairly impacts protected classes - and everybody else as well
value.excerpt: We've established that unethical AI hurts protected classes - but it doesn't stop there. Across industries and regions, unethical AI can impact the entire population. Here's some questions to consider.

value.title: Life academy promotes ethical ways AI can with help food security
value.excerpt: As part of its ongoing collaboration with two of the world's leading developers of AI software, the Pontifical Academy for Life will launch a new joint project looking at ethical ways artificial intelligence can be used to guarantee food security.

value.title: AI ethics groups are repeating one of society’s classic mistakes
value.excerpt: International organizations and corporations are racing to develop global guidelines for the ethical use of artificial intelligence. Declarations, manifestos, and recommendations are flooding the internet.

value.title: AI ethics - why teaching ethics and "ethics training" is problematic
value.excerpt: We've been trying to teach "ethics" for years. Teaching AI ethics to organizations is proving to be just as problematic. Yet as the urgency of ethical AI increases, we need a way forward. What are the options?

value.title: AI regulators can learn a lesson from the 1967 Outer Space Treaty
value.excerpt: Global leaders should take a lesson from the 1967 Outer Space Treaty, which regulated another emerging tech at a time of geopolitical turmoil.

value.title: Delivering AI to Warfighters Is Strategic Imperative

value.title: Defense Department Official Says 'Victory Garden' Approach Could Aid AI Effort
value.excerpt: The Defense Department can use the same methods that were used to bolster the war effort during World War II to advance artificial intelligence today, DOD officials say.

value.title: 16 Smart Ways You Can Leverage AI To Boost Your Business
value.excerpt: AI offers the best way for companies to automate repetitive processes and gain insight into their customer bases.

value.title: How the Trevor Project is using AI to prevent LGBTQ suicides
value.excerpt: Over the past three years, the nation’s largest suicide prevention organization for LGBTQ youth has undergone a major tech overhaul, most recently using machine learning to assess high-risk outreach.

value.title: Rethinking AI Ethics - Asimov has a lot to answer for
value.excerpt: Is the current obsession with AI Ethics doing any good? Maybe Asimov's Three Laws of Robotics wasn't such a great starting point after all

value.title: Why eliminating bias in AI is key to its success
value.excerpt: And it is AI that we must look closely at, which many experts tout as one of the most transformational technologies of our time, in terms of sheer impact on humanity. Global use of AI has ballooned by 270 per cent over the past five years,

value.title: Scalise hit with ethics complaint over doctored Barkan video
value.excerpt: The House Democratic campaign arm has filed a formal ethics complaint against Republican Whip Rep. Steve Scalise (La.), who shared a video doctored to alter the wording of a question posed by activist Ady Barkan to former Vice President Joe Biden.

value.title: Can Google’s New AI Ethics Service Be Of Any Help?
value.excerpt: Google’s cloud division has come out with their new AI Ethics Services for helping companies developing AI solutions.

value.title: A Path Forward For Eliminating Structural Bias In AI Tech
value.excerpt: Until federal and state lawmakers pass meaningful laws to keep biased data-based systems from proliferating, it falls to the companies that use artificial intelligence-based technologies to help develop socially responsible and ethical governance approaches that advance anti-discrimination principles,

value.title: To build responsibly, tech needs to do more than just hire chief ethics officers

value.title: The business imperative for ethical AI

value.title: Rolls-Royce reports breakthroughs in practical artificial intelligence ethics
value.excerpt: Royce announced on Wednesday that it had achieved two breakthroughs in the field of artificial intelligence (AI) ethics. These breakthroughs will be fully published later this year on the Rolls-Royce website under a Creative Commons licence.

value.title: Mia Dand’s Fight For Inclusion In The Endeavor To Save Humanity From The Dark Side Of AI
value.excerpt: Unapologetic. Unwavering. Determined. Mia Dand created 100 Brilliant Women in AI Ethics and spearheaded and cultivated a strong community, which brought out necessary change in the midst of pervasive AI.

value.title: Google offers to help others with the tricky ethics of AI
value.excerpt: The company plans to launch new AI ethics services before the end of the year. Initially, Google will offer others advice on tasks such as spotting racial bias in computer vision systems or developing ethical guidelines that govern AI projects.

value.title: Google Offers to Help Others With the Tricky Ethics of AI
value.excerpt: After learning its own ethics lessons the hard way, the tech giant will offer services like spotting racial bias or developing guidelines around AI projects.

value.title: Are Robots Eating Our Jobs? Not According To AI
value.excerpt: AI is replacing jobs while creating new ones and new job roles — profound benefits to the global economy await their arrival.

value.title: Professor Alena Buyx on the embedded ethics approach in AI development
value.excerpt: The increasing use of AI (artificial intelligence) in the development of new medical technologies demands greater attention to ethical aspects. An interdisciplinary team at the Technical University of Munich (TUM) advocates the integration of ethics from the very beginning of the development process of new technologies.

value.title: Bipartisan Policy Center And Ethics Policy For Artificial Intelligence: Inside The Beltway Thinking Is Still An Issue
value.excerpt: I am rarely impressed by Inside the Beltway thinking. My recent reading of “Turning Point” is an exception that proves the rule. For the second time this month, I came upon a discussion of governmental policy for AI,

value.title: UT Austin selected as home of National AI Institute focused on machine learning
value.excerpt: The National Science Foundation has selected The University of Texas at Austin to lead the NSF AI Institute for Foundations of Machine Learning, one of five new national AI institutes.

value.title: Michael Kanaan: The U.S. needs an AI ‘Sputnik moment’ to compete with China and Russia
value.excerpt: Minus AI,” Kanaan calls attention to the need for the U.S. to wake up to AI as a matter of global power, in the same way that China and Russia have.

value.title: A Dogfight Renews Concerns About AI's Lethal Potential
value.excerpt: Alphabet's DeepMind pioneered reinforcement learning. A California company used it to create an algorithm that defeated an F-16 pilot in a simulation.

value.title: The term ‘ethical AI’ is finally starting to mean something
value.excerpt: By framing ethical problems as narrow issues of fairness and accuracy, companies could equate expanded data collection with investing in “ethical AI.” The efforts of tech companies to champion fairness-related codes illustrate this point: In January 2018,

value.title: AI Weekly: Surveillance, structural racism, and the Biden 2020 presidential campaign
value.excerpt: What Joe Biden and Kamala Harris said about tech at DNC 2020 and a look at the kinds of AI and algorithmic bias mentioned in the Biden 2020 plan.

value.title: Exeter experts organize global AI summit to address ongoing healthcare crisis
value.excerpt: A global summit which aims to boost effective collaboration between experts working in Artificial Intelligence (AI) is being organised by academics at the University of Exeter.
